# cursor

**Instance Property**

The  cursor for continuing the search.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying var cursor: CKQueryOperation.Cursor? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The initial value of this property is the cursor that you provide to the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation/init(cursor:)] method. When you use a cursor, the operation ignores the contents of the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation/query] property. This property’s value is an opaque value that CloudKit provides. For more information, see the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKQueryOperation/queryCompletionBlock] property.

If you intend to specify or change the value in this property, do so before you execute the operation or submit it to a queue.

## Configuring the Query Operation

- **query**: The query for the search.
- **CKQueryOperation.Cursor**: An object that marks the stopping point for a query and the starting point for retrieving the remaining results.
- **zoneID**: The ID of the record zone that contains the records to search.
- **resultsLimit**: The maximum number of records to return at one time.
- **maximumResults**: A constant value that represents the maximum number of results CloudKit retrieves.
- **desiredKeys**: The fields of the records to fetch.
